chargeHist.descr: Criminal Damage to Property - Domestic Abuse Repeater

result.execSummary:
The defendant Sammy J Gates was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by all parties.   The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 8 months in the House of Correction, with credit for 91 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work.  Court orders all costs, assessments, fees and surcharges, DV surcharge.  Defendant to submit DNA sample and pay costs and surcharge.  All financial obligations to be paid by 8-5-2016 or a civil judgment to be entered.
Defense to advise defendant of appeal rights.
Defendant remanded.

Defendant Sammy J Gates in court with attorney Parker Charles Mathers.  Defendant Sammy J Gates in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State made new offer to resolve case which was accepted by the defendant.
As to counts 1,2,4, upon state's motion counts are dismissed and read in for sentencing.
As to count 3:  The repeater enhancer is deleted.   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.

COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FOR A FINAL PRETRIAL IN BRANCH 4.

Court ordered GPS supervision with a turnover to JusticePoint. The other conditions are drug, breathalyzer testing; and ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  The Defendant shall be released for legal (Attorney contacts).
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.

Attorney Parker Charles Mathers in court, Defendant Sammy J Gates not in court, in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin. SPEEDY JURY TRIAL entered previously. All parties notified as of August 3, 2015  this case is assigned to Judge Jeffrey Wagner,  Branch 38, in Room 502 of the Courthouse.  Court ordered all conditions of bail to remain in full effect, including the no contact order of Thomascena B. and S.B. (d.o.b. 04/12/97).  Defense would like to be heard as to bail.  Jury trial scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Speedy trial demand.

Defendant Sammy J Gates in court with attorney Parker Charles Mathers.  Defendant Sammy J Gates in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Randall Perez-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 04.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Due to Branch 4 in trial, case transferred to Prelim Court for Preliminary Hearing.    mld

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with THOMASCENA B., AND SB (4/12/97).
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Sammy J Gates in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Sammy J Gates in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge FLANAGAN, Branch 4.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 4.

  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
